title.rendered: 10 Best Email Marketing Courses to Take in 2023

content.rendered:
In 1971, Ray Tomlinson sent the first ever email. Those were the days of ARPANET (Advanced Research Projects Agency Network), and the email software was called “SNDMSG”. Later in 1978, the first commercial email was sent, which resulted in $13 million in sales!

Sitting in 2022 with social media on our smartphones, all these might seem like ancient dinosaurs. But believe it or not, email marketing is still one of the most effective and proven ways to gain the attention of your customers.

In this guide, I’ve selected the 10 best free and paid email marketing online courses for you from the 100+ email marketing courses on our catalog by following a well-defined methodology that you can find below.

But if you want to jump straight to the results, here are my top 10 picks. You can click on a course to jump to the corresponding section:

Course Workload In Brief
1. Think Outside the Inbox: Email Marketing (Google) 25 hours Well-built course with ample practice opportunities, taught by experts from Grow with Google
2. Email Marketing Course: Get Certified in Email Marketing (HubSpot Academy) 3-4 hours Well-structured course from Hubspot with free certificate, comes in four languages
3. Email Marketing Tutorial For Beginners 2022 (Simplilearn) 2 hours Free tutorial, good for learning the basics of running an email marketing campaign
4. Email Marketing: Cold Email Marketing Writing, Lead Gen 2022 (Udemy) 4 hours Best course focused on sending cold emails, teaches copywriting and generating leads
5. The ClickMinded Email Marketing Course (ClickMinded) 7-8 hours Comprehensive course, suited for in-company training, taught by industry experts
6. Writing Emails People Want to Read (LinkedIn Learning) 1 hour Short course, great for learning the basics of copywriting for emails quickly, free trial available
7. Email Marketing Unlocked (Neil Patel) Less than 1 hour Free tutorial, useful for learning tactics and strategies from a successful entrepreneur
8. Email Marketing Training Series (H-EDUCATE) 13 hours Extensive free tutorials covering everything from lead generation to email marketing automation
9. Email Marketing 2022. Increase sales with Email Marketing! (Udemy) 2 hours Practical, hand-on course on learning how to set up and run your email marketing campaign
10. Email marketing: diseño y gestión de campañas (Galileo) 10-12 hours University course in Spanish with practice opportunities, comes with a proctored exam

What is Email Marketing?

Email marketing is the process of sending commercial emails to a group of people to build business relationships. These people are your existing or potential customers who can help broaden your brand.

Emails can be in the form of advertisements, business requests or donations, with the objective of building loyalty, trust and brand awareness.

Why are Email Marketing skills important?

Email marketing has a return of investment (ROI) of $36 for every $1 spent, which means that if you spend $1, you’ll get $35 back. In 2019, there were 3.9 billion email users in the world. This number is expected to grow to 4.48 billion by 2024. That’s half the world’s population!

It has been seen that 72% of US consumers prefer email marketing over other types of promotion. A recent study by Litmus shows that consumers project email marketing to be the most relevant marketing channel in the next 10 years.

According to the US Burning Glass Labor Insight Report, 86% of business leaders report that digital commerce will be the most important route to growth. There are 218,000 U.S. job openings in this growing field, with a median entry-level salary of $51,000.

What is my experience with Email Marketing?

As a Generalist at Class Central, a large part of my job is to send emails to instructors to inform them of our BCGs. If it clicks, we get to form stronger bonds with them, which potentially increases our reach to more learners.

My colleague, @Pat, also sends emails to learners who might want to write reviews for The Report. She successfully encourages them, and we have published many review articles as a result. We also send monthly newsletters to our subscribers to increase brand awareness, showcase most popular topics, and advertise new products and services.

Besides that, I am a Guided Project Instructor and a Beta Tester at Coursera, having tested many courses before they’re officially launched. I have taken over 50 online courses in various subjects.

My experience as an online learner and teacher has given me some perspective on what to look for in an online course. I used my experience to evaluate each course in this list.

Course Ranking Methodology

I built this ranking following the now tried-and-tested methodology I used in previous rankings (you can find them all here). It involves a three-step process:

  1. Research: I started by leveraging Class Central’s database with 100K online courses and 200K+ reviews. Then, I made a preliminary selection of 100+ email marketing courses by rating, reviews, and bookmarks.
  2. Evaluate: I read through reviews on Class Central, Reddit, and course providers to understand what other learners thought about each course and combined it with my own experience as a learner.
  3. Select: Well-made courses were picked if they presented valuable and engaging content and they have to fit in a set of criteria and be ranked accordingly: comprehensive curriculum, release date, affordability, ratings and enrollments.

The end result is a unique selection of courses that combines a decade of Class Central data and my own experience as an online learner to try to get the best of both worlds. So far, I’ve spent more than 12 hours building this list, and I’ll continue to update it.

Course Ranking Statistics

Here are some statistics regarding this course ranking:

  • Combined, these courses have accrued over 65.3K enrollments.
  • 7 courses are free or free-to-audit and 3 courses are paid.
  • The most-represented course provider in the ranking is YouTube, with 2 courses.
  • 9 courses are in English, and 1 course is in Spanish.
  • The Email Marketing subject is followed by 3.6K learners on Class Central, and accounts for over 100 courses on Class Central catalog.

So without further ado, let’s get to my picks for the best email marketing online courses.

1. Think Outside the Inbox: Email Marketing (Google)

My first pick for the best email marketing online course is the free-to-audit Think Outside the Inbox: Email Marketing, offered by Google on Coursera.

Being the tech giant that Google is, there’s no doubt that this course will easily make it to the first spot on this list. A 2021 report shows that 75% of Google Career Certificate graduates in the US report see a positive impact on their career within six months.

This means taking this course will prepare you for a new career in the high-growth fields of email marketing. You’ll learn from subject-matter experts at Google, get hands-on experience, and will be equipped to apply for entry-level jobs.

Excellent course. I learnt a lot from it and my teacher was excellent! Thank you so much and I hope I will be able to apply this information once I get a job! – Gaurav B, Coursera learner

What You’ll Learn

In the first week, you’ll be introduced to email marketing. You’ll learn what email marketing is, its importance, and how to meet business goals. You’ll also use the PESTLE and SWOT frameworks to set SMART email marketing goals, and apply the best practices in email marketing.

In the next week, you’ll take a look at the most common types of email marketing. You’ll learn about acquisition emails and welcome emails, newsletters and promotional emails, and retention emails. You’ll also craft email copy, write subject lines, and create preview text.

After that, in the third week, you’ll learn about useful tools for email marketing. You’ll create and segment email lists, write engaging emails, work with email marketing tools like HubSpot and Mailchimp, and create an email marketing campaign report.

Finally, in the last week, you’ll conduct a mock email marketing campaign. You’ll apply all that you’ve learned during this course to complete the campaign. You’ll set SMART goals, segment your email list and complete an email series, and end the course by analyzing and presenting the results.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 5 weeks. Each week involves about 4 to 7 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and practice quizzes.

Other than practice quizzes, there are other practice exercises in the form of plugins. These are interactive activities embedded separately within the course.

All in all, there’s a pretty good amount of practice opportunities in this course. Paid learners can take the graded quizzes and earn a certificate upon completion.

Institution Google
Provider Coursera
Instructor Miriam
Level Beginner
Workload 25 hours
Enrollments 9.3K
Rating 4.8/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • This course is the fourth of seven courses in the Google Digital Marketing & E-commerce Professional Certificate.
  • Google Career Certificates is a Top Instructor at Coursera, with 200+ courses and 4M+ learners.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

2. Email Marketing Course: Get Certified in Email Marketing (HubSpot Academy)

My second pick for the best email marketing online course is the free Email Marketing Course: Get Certified in Email Marketing, on HubSpot Academy.

Emails need to be human, helpful and holistic – this is what the instructor says at the beginning of the course. Indeed, if you want your company to stand out, it’s important not only to send emails to your clients, but to actually make them look sensible and real.

HubSpot is a leading developer and marketer of inbound marketing tools. Learning from these experts is a great way to get started with email marketing, and their certification adds extra credibility to your portfolio as well. What’s more: this certificate is completely free!

What You’ll Learn

You’ll begin the course by learning how to build an effective email marketing strategy. You’ll create a contact management and segmentation strategy so that you can send contextual emails and create engaging conversions.

Sending the right email gives you a better chance of converting your leads into customers. That’s why, you’ll take a look at the key components of how to send the right email to the right person at the time. You’ll also learn how to identify trends in your email deliverability metrics.

Next, you’ll understand why content and design are equally important for your marketing emails, and start designing emails that provide value. You’ll also learn why analyzing your emails is important and the steps you need to take to perform this analysis.

Before sending an email, it’s important to run tests to update those emails. That’s why you’ll learn what types of tests you can run on your marketing emails. Finally, you’ll hear from industry experts on how to develop relationships through lead nurturing. You’ll learn about the foundations of lead nurturing and how to implement them.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 9 modules. Each module involves about 15 to 30 hours of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Throughout the videos, you’ll not only learn about email marketing, but will also hear from industry experts, including HubSpot professionals. The course is completely free and all learners will get a certificate upon completion.

Provider HubSpot Academy
Instructor Courtney Sembler
Level Beginner
Workload 3-4 hours
Certificate Free

Fun Facts

  • This course is available in three other languages aside from English: German, Spanish and French.
  • Not only that, there are dedicated instructors for each language.
  • All HubSpot Academy course certifications are 100% free!

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

3. Email Marketing Tutorial For Beginners 2022 (Simplilearn)

My third pick for the best email marketing online course is the free Email Marketing Tutorial For Beginners 2022, offered by Simplilearn on YouTube.

Available on YouTube, this course teaches all the important concepts of email marketing in just 2 hours. It is quick and simple, and a good part of the course covers the theory behind email marketing. So if you want to get going with email marketing right away, without paying a penny, this course is for you.

What You’ll Learn

You’ll begin the course by learning why email marketing is important for your business. You’ll learn what email marketing is, set up your email marketing environment, understand the benefits of email marketing, and take a look at A/B testing.

Then, you’ll optimize your email content, learn about the different types of email campaigns, and understand how to engage with new subscribers. Finally, you’ll get a tutorial on Mailchimp, an email marketing tool, and become interview-ready with email marketing interview questions and answers.

How You’ll Learn

The course is a single video, broken down into 10 chapters. Each chapter involves about 15 to 30 minutes of work.

Channel Simplilearn
Provider YouTube
Level Beginner
Workload 2 hours
Certificate Not available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

4. Email Marketing: Cold Email Marketing Writing, Lead Gen 2022 (Udemy)

My fourth pick for the best email marketing online course is Email Marketing: Cold Email Marketing Writing, Lead Gen 2022, on Udemy.

“Cold email” is an email sent for the first time to whom you want to build a business relationship with. So, if you want someone to become your customer and gain more sales opportunities, the cold email marketing strategies in this course is what you’re looking for.

In this email marketing course, you’ll learn all about cold email marketing, hear from the instructor about his journey, and learn to write effective, persuasive cold emails that result in a boost in your sales.

What You’ll Learn

The broad topics that you’ll learn in this course are cold emailing, copywriting, lead generation, and email marketing. You’ll learn from the instructor how he secured a meeting with the CEO and executive team of a $30 million business from just one single automated cold email marketing template.

You’ll also learn how you can achieve open rates over 50% and boost your clicks and responses, change people’s minds using email copywriting words, apply the six big tips for writing effectively, write persuasive cold emails, and implement the best copywriting frameworks for cold emails.

He’ll also teach you his personal B2B copywriting framework, various ways to acquire good cold email lists, techniques for automating email sequences and testing results, and also guide you through email marketing for sales and business development.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 6 sections. Each section involves about 30 minutes to 1.5 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and quizzes.

Paid learners will have access to all the course materials as well as quizzes, and receive a certificate upon completion.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Dekker Fraser
Level Beginner
Workload 4 hours
Enrollments 25.2K
Rating 4.8/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • This course is one of the highest rated courses on Udemy on email marketing.
  • Fraser is the Global Product Marketing Manager for Sony PlayStation.
  • He has an MBA in Marketing from Northwestern University.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

5. The ClickMinded Email Marketing Course (ClickMinded)

My fifth pick for the best email marketing online course is The ClickMinded Email Marketing Course, offered by ClickMinded.

While researching for this article, my friend, @fabio, told me that this course is so good that it needs to be at the fifth spot at least. And that’s despite it being the most expensive course on this list. I got to know about this course from @dhawal, since he advised us to take this course on Class Central’s behalf.

These kinds of courses are usually funded by companies for their employees’ development and the companies’ growth as a whole. So, this course is more appropriate for you if you want to learn on your company’s behalf.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll learn why email marketing is different from any other channel, the three types of emails and two methods of distribution, and the three fundamental principles of email marketing.

In the next module, you’ll learn how to build a “lifecycle” strategy, borrow tactics from big companies,  “win back” users who have stopped interacting with your emails, understand “list hygiene”, and broadcast email to your entire list without ending up in spam.

In the third module, you’ll learn how to get the entire picture for each of your email subscribers, the 4 types of data: implicit data, explicit data, user personas, and engagement, and the right way to use tags and custom fields.

You’ll also take a look at 10 powerful segmentation strategies, implement segmentation, and understand how to use “decision-based workflows” to automatically segment and email subscribers based on the collected data.

In the next module, you’ll learn how to create a world-class email campaign, create a 3-step framework to overcome the major challenges, learn effective copywriting tactics to make your emails stand out, and use a step-by-step process to send error-free email campaigns.

After that, in the fifth module, you’ll get step-by-step walkthroughs on how to set up 8 powerful automated campaigns from scratch, and build a system that manages all of your campaigns and prevents conflicts between them.

Moving one, in the next module, you’ll explore the 8 metrics to measure and track before you optimize your campaigns, discover the three levers you can use to optimize any metric, and make sure your emails reach your subscribers’ inbox.

Finally, the seventh module is a bonus where you’ll take a look at all of ClickMinded’s favorite email marketing tools to increase deliverability, get third-party data about your subscribers, write better emails, create interactive emails, and more.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 7 modules. Each module involves about 1 hour of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and quizzes.

The course teaches high-level strategies and provides tactical walkthroughs. There is a final exam at the end of the courses. Paid learners will receive a certificate upon passing the quizzes and the final exam, which can also be integrated with LinkedIn.

Institution ClickMinded
Instructor Lucas Chevillard
Level Mixed
Workload 7-8 hours
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Chevillard has been an Email Strategist from Airbnb.
  • He is also the Director of Advertiser Growth at  Matchmade where he helps brands and creators work together.
  • He has previously worked with Home as well.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

6. Writing Emails People Want to Read (LinkedIn Learning)

My sixth pick for the best email marketing online course is Writing Emails People Want to Read, on LinkedIn Learning.

This is the shortest email marketing course on this list, enabling you to learn the basics of copywriting for emails quickly and easily. Within less than an hour, the instructor will teach you how to be both personal and direct with your emails at the same time, write engaging emails, and convert prospects to customers. Free trial is available for this course.

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you learn some little known secrets about writing great emails. You’ll see that all emails are personal emails, take a look at the three types of emails, understand inquiry, transactional emails, marketing and sales emails, and learn how to be clearly understood.

In the next module, you’ll learn how to be clear and bold, but not Pushy or whiny. Good email is like good education, that’s why, you’ll learn the art of graceful interruption, the number one question, and how to get your clients to write you back.

After that, in the third module, you’ll understand how to be compelling. You’ll write great stories, add values and character, use the three most important words, and see how to write a terrible email.

In the fourth module, you’ll see how often you should send emails. You’ll learn what time of the  day is the best to send emails, handle opens, clicks, and unsubscribes, and understand how many emails are too many.

In the next module, you’ll learn to write emails that get your clients to buy, see where to find sure-fire copy, learn how to make an email blast feel personal, take a look at the all-important call to action, and understand whether or not you should send a newsletter.

Finally, in the sixth module, you’ll learn some advanced strategies for email marketing. You’ll see when an email is not an email, write curated content and affiliate marketing, learn what to do if it’s been too long, and write FAQs and About Us pages.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 6 modules. Each module involves about 10 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos and tests.

The videos are very short and easy to digest. Paid learners can access the course materials, take the tests, and earn a certificate upon completion.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Sam Bennett
Level Beginner
Workload 1 hour
Enrollments 165.8K
Rating 4.7/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Bennett is the author of the bestselling books, “Get It Done” and “Start Right Where You Are”.
  • She also founded TheRealSamBennett.com to help people lead innovative, productive and fulfilled lives.
  • She is also a speaker, teacher, creativity-productivity, and even a theater actor!

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

7. Email Marketing Unlocked (Neil Patel)

My seventh pick for the best email marketing online course is the free Email Marketing Unlocked, offered by Neil Patel on YouTube.

Neil Patel is a known face within the community of entrepreneurs, marketers and beyond. However, he’s not only working for himself, he’s also giving away his knowledge on YouTube for free. Being so successful, he has much understanding of email marketing, so, this course is worth giving a shot.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn how to go from zero to 50,000 email subscribers, take a look at lead generation tactics the instructor used to acquire over 2 million subscribers, and use high-converting workflows and sequences that you can copy, paste and send.

You’ll also learn how to maximize your customer lifetime value with email marketing, increase your email results three times by applying frameworks and workflows hacks, and master email marketing by applying current marketing secrets.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 7 videos. Each video involves about 6 to 10 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel Neil Patel
Provider YouTube
Instructor Neil Patel
Level Beginner
Workload Less than 1 hour
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Patel was awarded a top 100 entrepreneur under the age of 30 by President Obama!
  • He is a New York Times best selling author, The Wall Street Journal top influencer, Forbes top 10 marketers, and Entrepreneur Magazine 100 most brilliant companies.
  • He has also been featured on our best Social Media Marketing courses in #5.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

8. Email Marketing Training Series (H-EDUCATE)

My eighth pick for the best email marketing online course is the free Email Marketing Training Series, offered by H-EDUCATE on YouTube.

Even though this one is a YouTube course, it’s pretty long one and about the same duration as a university MOOC. The instructor spends a good amount of time explaining the theory as well as demonstrating each topic carefully. He also covers the uses of several external mailing tools as well.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll learn about lead generation, email marketing tips, email list building strategies, validate your email lists, set up and install Mailwizz and Mailster, set up Gmail with SendBlaster, and use Amazon SES as your SMTP service.

You’ll also learn to use free email verifiers, G suite Gmail warm up tips, set up Bounce server for Mailwizz/Mailster using a Gmail account, use a custom SMTP mail server with Sendblaster, validate emails, and understand why emails are sent to Spam.

You’ll then build a simple link cloaker, learn what is SPF (Sender Policy Framework), DKIM (DomainKeys Identified Mail), scrape emails, set up a cold outreach system with Postal SMTP and Mautic, set up DMARC and Office365 cold email, and send bulk cold emails without spamming.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 54 videos. Each module involves about 10 to 15 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel H-EDUCATE
Provider YouTube
Instructor Hasan
Level Beginner
Workload 13 hours
Certificate Not available

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

9. Email Marketing 2022. Increase sales with Email Marketing! (Udemy)

My ninth pick for the best email marketing online course is Email Marketing 2022. Increase sales with Email Marketing!, on Udemy.

In this course, you’ll get hands-on experience in email marketing. You’ll learn directly from industry experts who have specialized in this field for years. It is recommended that you have an online project that you are currently working on, so that you can apply your knowledge in real life.

What You’ll Learn

In this course, you’ll understand why your business needs email marketing, build your customer database, understand GDPR regulation and Privacy Policy, learn different types of emails and how to use them, segment your database, learn basic elements of email, and design the first email with SendPulse.

You’ll also design the first subscription form with SendPulse, avoid emails going into spam, measure email marketing performance, work with Google Postmaster, tag links with URL Builder and shorten links with Bit.ly, and learn about chatbots and how to work with SendPulse chatbot builder.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 7 sections. Each module involves about 25 to 45 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and quizzes.

Paying learners will have access to all the course materials as well as quizzes, and receive a certificate upon completion.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Anton Voroniuk
Level Beginner
Workload 2 hours
Enrollments 24.4K
Rating 4.6/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • A free copy of the book, “Cutting-Edge Digital Marketing. How to attract customers and increase online sales“, written by the instructor, is also provided with this course.
  • Voroniuk is a Digital Marketer and Google Academy Trainer.
  • He is also the co-owner of Webpromo Digital Agency.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

10. Email marketing: diseño y gestión de campañas (Galileo University)

My tenth pick for the best email marketing online course is the free-to-audit Email marketing: diseño y gestión de campañas, offered by Galileo University on edX.

This is the only university course on this list, teaching email marketing in Spanish. So if you understand the language, this is a must try. It will teach you pretty much everything you need to know about this subject and also introduce you to tools such as Mailchimp, Autopilot and Active Campaign.

What You’ll Learn

You’ll begin the course with an introduction to email marketing. You’ll learn how to design and manage email marketing campaigns, build an efficient database, understand broadcasting email, email copywriting, and designing effective templates.

Then, you’ll understand what email automation is, learn about development of sales, educational and prospect nutrition sequence, identify and select email marketing platforms, implement email marketing campaigns, measure and analyze campaign performance, and optimize your emails.

By the end of this course, you’ll be able to build a personalized email, generate and segment lead databases, create successful email marketing campaigns, and automate your sales process using tools such as Mailchimp, Autopilot and Active Campaign.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 5 modules. Each module involves about 2 to 4 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and practice quizzes.

Throughout the course, there are several graded and ungraded assessments, and a final proctored exam at the end. Paying learners can take the graded tests and earn a certificate upon completion.

Institution Galileo University
Provider edX
Instructor Jojo Giuffra, Miguel Morales
Level Beginner
Workload 10-12 hours
Enrollments 15.5K
Rating 4.7/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Giuffra is a Google Expert (Marketing) at Galileo University.
  • Morales is the Director of the Digital Education Area at Galileo University.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.
